intro: Mucronea californica var. suksdorfii, commonly known as the Suksdorf's mucronea, is a rare flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in coastal scrub habitats. It produces small white to pale yellow flowers and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
